Pre-Game Insights: The New York Yankees are 86-62 this season and have won three games in a row.
The Boston Red Sox are 74-74 this season and have lost three of their last four games.
Gerrit Cole (6-4, 3.36 ERA) is the projected starting pitcher for the Yankees, while Brayan Bello (13-7, 4.70 ERA) is the projected starter for the Red Sox.
The Yankees have a 6-2 record in their last eight games, while the Red Sox have a 4-9 record in their last 13 games.
The Yankees have covered the run line in each of their last five day games against the Red Sox at Yankee Stadium following a win.
Six of the Red Sox's last seven day games after playing the previous day have gone UNDER the total runs line.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees are 41-32 at home this year, while the Red Sox are 39-34 on the road.
Boston has struggled over the last couple of weeks, while the Yankees are in a strong position in the AL East.
